questions.question: Has the situation ………………………?
questions.description: We use the past participle form of the verb after has, have and had.

questions.question: The accused ………………………… the verdict with anxiety.
questions.description: We use the simple past to simply state that something happened in the past.

questions.question: A wide spread outbreak of plague …………………………… in the 14th century.
questions.description: We use the simple past to simply state that something happened in the past.

questions.question: He did not ………………………… any of the samples presented to him.
questions.description: We use the infinitive (the first form of the verb) after do, does and did.

questions.question: Last month I ………………………. to Canada to see my brother.
questions.description: We use the simple past to simply state that we did something at a past time.

questions.question: There is no use phoning now. They must …………………………..
questions.description: We can use the structure must have + past participle to predict the present.

questions.question: He ……………………………. much of his spare time in the library.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about habits and preferences.

questions.question: We were …………………………… to hear the news.
questions.description: Saddened is the past participle form of sadden.

questions.question: He ………………………….. ill for a week when his brother came.
questions.description: We use the past perfect to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and had continued until another event took place.

questions.question: We ……………………………… hurry, we have got plenty of time.
questions.description: When need is used as a modal auxiliary, questions and negatives are made without do.

questions.question: I ……………………… visit my parents every Sunday now I go once a month.
questions.description: We use used to to talk about past habits.
